H0.text: A gene is the coded sequence (PLAT) on chromosome 8 that encodes tissue plasminogen activator, a natural blood thinner used to treat heart attacks and strokes and produced through genetic engineering.

H1.text: A protein is tissue plasminogen activator, a natural blood thinner coded by the PLAT gene on chromosome 8, used to treat heart attacks and strokes, and producible through genetic engineering.

H2.text: A platelet is tissue plasminogen activator, a natural blood thinner encoded by the PLAT gene on chromosome 8 that is used to treat people who have heart attacks and strokes and can be produced via genetic engineering.

H3.text: A DNA molecule is tissue plasminogen activator, the natural blood thinner coded as PLAT on chromosome 8, used to treat heart attacks and strokes, and producible through genetic engineering.

A4.text: Human tPA is encoded by the PLAT gene, and has a molecular weight of ~70 kDa in the single-chain form.

A5.text: Although a small fraction of patients 90 years and above treated with tPA for acute ischemic stroke recover, most patients have a poor 30-day functional outcome or die.

A7.text: Widening the Window : Strategies to buy time in treating ischemic stroke - Scientific American (August 2005)
